section.title: Locate Saved Search
section.p: To locate a Saved Search, click on the Saved Search name in the Saved Searches Tab. Clicking on a Saved Search in the Tab will display the Saved Search details, and populate the results table with the search results. Saved Searches and applicable actions can be located by clicking the "Saved Search Management".

Here, the Saved Search Management page displays all of the existing Saved Searches that the user is allowed to view. For a detailed description of this page refer to the Saved Search Management Page section.

Saved Searches can either be saved as public or private. Private Saved Searches can be viewed by the user that created them if they have the capability SavedSearch_Private:read, or by other users who have the capability SavedSearchOthers_Private:read. Public Saved Searches can be viewed by the owner if they have the capability SavedSearch_Public:read, or by other users who have the capability SavedSearchOthers_Public:read. If a public Saved Search has the same name as one of your private Saved Searches, the sidebar will include the sharing permission in brackets after the name of each.

Alternatively, the contents of a Saved Search can be returned by entering its name in the search box. Should a private and public Saved Search of the same name exist in the system, the private Saved Search will be returned. Therefore, the process outlined in the paragraph above should be used to return a public Saved Search where a private Saved Search exists of the same name.
